creator: craquerpro@yahoo.es
text:
Hi,

I call repeatedlyu this task in a Ant build.xml script:

		<concat append="yes" binary="yes" destfile="A">
			<filelist dir="tmp" files="B"/>
		</concat>

I expect the A file to be appended with the contents of B.
What I get is that A file is overwritten with the contents of A.
If I remove the binary attribute it works ok, i.e., it appends content instead
of replacing it.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: Have you tested this with Ant 1.7.0?

The following shows the problem on Ant 1.7.0

   <target name="b">
    <delete file="A" quiet="yes"/>
    <delete file="B" quiet="yes"/>
    <echo file="A">This is A</echo>
    <echo file="B">This is B</echo>
    <concat append="yes" binary="yes" destfile="A">
      <filelist dir="." files="B"/>
    </concat>
    <concat><path path="A"/></concat>
  </target>
  <target name="no-b">
    <delete file="A" quiet="yes"/>
    <delete file="B" quiet="yes"/>
    <echo file="A">This is A</echo>
    <echo file="B">This is B</echo>
    <concat append="yes"  destfile="A">
      <filelist dir="." files="B"/>
    </concat>
    <concat><path path="A"/></concat>
  </target>
creator: peterreilly@apache.org

text: Fixed in SVN HEAD. Thanks for the report!
